Description: Identification of Microorganisms: Concentration (any type), for infectious agent
Identification of Microorganisms: Culture, tubercle or other acid-fast bacilli (e.g., TB, AFB, mycobacteria) any source, with isolation and presumptive identification of isolates
Identification of Organism from Primary Source and Sensitivity Studies: Fluorescent and/or acid fast stain for bacteria, fungi, parasites, viruses or cell types
Identification of Microorganisms: Culture, mycobacterial, definitive identification, each isolate
Additional Culture Typing Techniques: Gas liquid chromatography (GLC) or high pressure liquid chromatography (HPLC) method
Additional Culture Typing Techniques: Identification by nucleic acid (DNA or RNA) probe, direct probe technique per culture or isolate, each organism probed
Additional Culture Typing Techniques: Other methods
Identification of Organism from Primary Source and Sensitivity Studies: Mycobacteria, proportion method, each agent
Bronchiectasis With Acute Lower Respiratory Infection
